page.title: 13FISHING IN GLENURQUHART.
page.content: {Fishing}is one of the main recreational sports in the Glen.Loch Ness is a convenient spot for fishing, where Borlum Bay is good for{Brown {Trout}and even{Salmon.}There are a few pools on the River Enrick which are good for{trout}and when the river is in spate you can also catch{Salmon. The hill lochs which surround the Glen are also regularly fished.Access is by motorbike or by a six mile hike on foot.These lochs are good for{Brown {Trout}the lochs that are over 2000 feet have{Arctic Char}.A few of the lower lochs are fished for{Pike}.The fishing season is mostly in summer, from March to September.The best bait is worm but fly and toby are also used.The{Otter Board}is a piece of wood with a long line coming back to the shore with flies dropping from the line.This poachers method works well.
